Figure Effects
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 3 Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Figure Effects
By gogators on Monday, August 25, 2003 - 07:49 am:

I was playing the other day and I was checking up on my Dragon and it was "Chubby",I was wondering if it has the same effects as MR2,form does on monsters.

By Toa3t on Monday, August 25, 2003 - 03:48 pm:

In a word, "dunno."

Lisa's done tests by feeding different foods to monsters while resting every day of their lives, and this showed no affect on lifespan. I'm inferring that she fed fattening foods (Meat, Fish) and the form got to "Chubby" while Carrots and Peaches might go towards "Skinny."

So, there's probably no affect on lifespan, and I've got no idea how it affects dodging and taking hits.

By Dracx Raiden Rancher on Wednesday, December 3, 2003 - 07:03 am:

I have raised 4 monsters now and as of my experience in my many battles, form does make a difference to dodging ability. So far I've only noticed a small difference but I have yet to let any of my monsters who have gotten fat to fight. I usually reduce thier weight back down before battling. But for me yes form has made a difference for me..

As for lifespan I have noticed no effect on lifespan by form.
